chapter.title: Balances and Transactions
chapter.para: The Balances and transactions function provide facilities to manage your accounts and transactions through the .
This menu provides a number of functions, as follows:

listitem.para: Display a summary of transactions for accounts the user has authority to use..
Produce an on-screen or softcopy statement for an account the User has authority to use.
Search for specific transactions within the .
Search for specific Pending transactions within the .
Start Batch processes in the Portal.
Inquire on Batch processes in the Portal.
Display a list of transactions available for your action.
View advices and notifications from the Bank.

section.title: Account Summary
section.para: The Account Summary Option allows the user to see a summary of accounts they are authorised to use. When selected, this option will display a list of accounts the user is authorised for, and a summary of their current balances. A set of search criteria fields are available at the top of the screen, to narrow the accounts listed to just those with specific attributes.
The list can be filtered by entering search criteria in the Entity, Account Number or Account CCY to view Fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: Screen (default) returns the list of matching records on the same page with the usual sorting features.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.

The columns returned in the list of accounts are the following:
Field
Description
Account
The currency, number and descriptions of the account.
External Account
An indicator if the account is external and accurate balances are not available.
Account type
The type of account.
CCY
The currency the account is held in.
Ledger Balance
The ledger balance of the account, if available, in it's local currency.
Available Balance
The available balance in the account, if available.
Equivalent Ledger Balance
The ledger balance of the account, if available, in the requested currency.
Equivalent Available Balance
The available balance in the account, if available, in the requested currency.
Below the account information is a summary of all the accounts for each Entity the user has access to, with its Equivalent Ledger Balance.
Click on any account listed to launch the Account Statement function for that account.

section.title: Account Statement
section.para: The Account Statement Option provides the user with a statement of the accounts they are authorised to use. When selected, this option will display a list of criteria that must be selected to identify the account and period of the statement.
The fields required are as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: The Company the user belongs to.
Enter the entity the account belongs to. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
Enter the account number of the required statement. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.

entry.para: Select the period the statement should report on. Valid periods are: Current Day Previous Day Current Month Previous Month From: to: - enter the from and to statement dates.

section.para: There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: Screen (default) returns the list of matching records on the same page with the usual sorting features.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.
When all fields have been completed, click the SEARCH button to produce the statement.
The statement produced will show the following columns:

entry.para: Field
Description
The date the transaction took place.
The time the transaction took place.
The description of the transaction.
The amount that was deposited.
The amount that was withdrawn.
The balance in the account, after the transaction.

The available balance in the account, if available, in the requested currency.

section.para: All amounts are displayed in the account currency.

section.title: Transaction Search
section.para: The Transaction Search function allows the user to display a list of all or some transactions that have been created in the portal, that the user has authority to view and manage. This list can be filtered by specifying search criteria in the fields about the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Valid filter/search criteria are:
Field
Type
Description
Business Area
Select whether Trade or Cash transactions should be displayed.
Entity
Enter the entity the account belongs to. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
System ID
Select the required system ID or "*" for all.
Account Number
Enter the account number the required transactions are related to (Valid for Cash transactions only). Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.
Product
If known, select the required product the transaction is related to, from the dropdown menu.
Product Subtype
If known, select the required product subtype the transaction is related to, from the dropdown menu.
Status
Select the status of the transactions to be displayed, from the dropdown menu. Valid Status values are:Incomplete Pending Submitted Processed
Customer Reference
If known, enter the Customer reference number.
File Reference/CO Number
If known, enter the file reference or CO number. (Valid for Cash transactions only)
CCY
Enter the currency of the required transactions. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid currency codes.
Minimum Amount
Enter the minimum amount of the transactions to be displayed. (Valid for Cash transactions only)
Maximum Amount
Enter the maximum amount of the transactions to be displayed. (Valid for Cash transactions only)
Counterparty
Enter the Counterparty associated with the transactions
Last Modified Date From/To
Enter the date range that transactions should be modified between.
Maturity Date From/to
Enter the date range that transactions should mature between.

section.title: Batch Inquiry
section.para: The Batch Inquiry function allows the user to inquire on batch processes that have been run in the . When selected, this option will display a list of batch processes that have been executed.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Batch ID, Batch Date, Batch Maker, E-sign Field 1 or E-sign Field 2 fields.
To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: Report Execution
section.para: Standard reports can be created by the Bank or other authorised users within the company, using the Report Designer function. The report Execution function allows users to execute those reports.

When this function is selected, a list of previously created reports and their descriptions, is displayed and can be scrolled through to find the required report. Alternatively, the report name can be entered in the search criteria fields.
To execute the report, double click on the report name. Depending on the report setup, some reports may require extra parameters to be entered when executed.

section.condition: TITLE=Balances and Transactions: Advices and Notifications
section.title: Advices and Notifications
section.para: This function allows the user to view advices and notifications regarding specific transactions, that have been received from the Bank. When the bank approves, processes or queries transactions form a customer, advises and notifications are sent back to the customer informing them of the action that has occurred. In most cases, these notifications do not require any response or action from the customer, but allow them to keep track of the status of their requests.

When selected, this option will display a list of notifications that have received from the Bank. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System ID, Entity, Advices Type, Account Number, Bank Ref. or Dates from and To fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: Screen (default) returns the list of matching records on the same page with the usual sorting features.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.
